Sunday, my birthday, Conner wakes up at the butt crack of dawn (8:30am) and proceeds to eat 7 peanut butter cookies for his breakfast. Then, he eats a bowl of cereal because he's still hungry.


I hear the boys just as they're finishing their cereal and I wake Pat up. Pat wakes up and feels like crapt (massive headache, nausia, etc.) and is a lump on the couch in about 10 minutes.


Meanwhile, I'm in the bathroom putting my eyes (contacts) in and I can hear Conner all way way from his room to ours and he's saying, "Suck my Dick!" over and over. I leave our bedroom and just stare down the hall towards Conner's room. Tyler comes out of his room and looks at me and I say, "Yeah, I heard it." Pat is out in the living room being a zombie and didn't hear a word of it. Apparently he tuned it all out.


I told him, "Well, I heard the phrase 'Suck my dick!' more than I cared to and if you don't do something about it I will and it's not going to be pretty." Then I turned around and closed the door to our bedroom.


I asked Conner to please stop talking so rudely because I didn't want to spend my birthday like that. He ignored me and Pat when he echoed what I said.


Needless to say, between Conner's attitude, Tyler's yelling at the video game he was playing and Pat being out of commission . . . my birthday morning was horrible.


Pat eventually moved into the bedroom to lay down. From then until 11:50am when I finally got dressed and cleaned up the kitchen from my solo breakfast, the yelling and shouting and rude behavior didn't stop.


So, I told Pat that as soon as I was ready, I was going to leave because I couldn't take it any more.


Before I left, I confronted Conner and asked him how many cookies he at and eventually got it out of him. I told him that he just lost his right to anything sweet (this included chocolate milk, pop and anything else) until Tuesday.


And then I left.


I filled up on the cheapest gas I could find in a 10 minute radius, picked up at $1 chicken sandwich & drink from McDonald's and found a parking lot and read my book for an hour.


Fast forward to Monday . . . we're having hamburgers and home made french fries and the boys are bickering back and forth at the dinner table. This happens every night at dinner and I'm getting fed up.


Last night at dinner. I make my first pot roast and it turns out okay except the gravy is a little salty. No biggie we all survived. However, the fighting between the boys is wearing on me and I was very close to throwing it in and eating by myself in the living room. Instead I said to Pat, "Maybe you should come home, make dinner and then have them ruin it for a change."


I was quite pissed by then but he just looked at me and said, "Huh?"


I just took a deep breath and then said, "They fight at the table every night for dinner. I'm sick of it. So maybe you should make dinner after you get home from work and let them ruin dinner."


Later, after Pat took Conner to the store to find some more items for his Halloween costume (which I thought he shouldn't have done because his attitude was horrible) things were quiet. Tyler did his homework and then when they came back, it started all over again.


I was reading my book on the couch and Pat sat down next to me to watch some TV. A couple of minutes later, Conner comes and sits down next to Pat and he's playing with gum. "Why did you buy him gum? It's just going to end up on the floor again and I'm going to step in it, again."


Then, the attitude started again and eventually he went into Tyler's room and left every single thing that ran on electricity, turned on.


By then, I had had enough and retreated to the bedroom and planned on staying in there for the rest of the evening. But not before I turned off everything in Conner's room.


I've told them, if I find it and it's on when you haven't been in your room for more than 10 minutes it's getting turned off whether they saved their game or not. And, 20 minutes later, Conner came out and had a fit and started throwing things in his room.


Pat went in and then told me why he was upset and the words, "Oh well..." came out of my mouth.


About 30 minutes later, Pat comes in and asks if I'm going to stay in here all night. I said yes and he said that he didn't want me to be upset.


Well, it's kinda hard to not be upset when those two are acting up and ignoring me and Pat and doing whatever they want. So, to save my sanity I left their presence and retreated to the one place that's mine. He said that he gets upset when I'm upset and I said, "Well, I'm sorry but that's just how it is. They act like shits and get out of control, I'm not going to sit around and watch it happen."


So, for the past three days and nights I've had enough. I have no more patience for their bad behavior and it's taking everything I have to keep myself from yelling at them.


Just last night, Conner had another fit about me throwing away the pumpkin seeds. When I informed him that I won't bake them (they're in the fridge right now) until he can consistantly be have for more than 30 minutes at a time. He yelled, "Well thanks for telling me now!" I just shruged and said, "Oh well," and walked away.


It hasn't been very long since we've all been here (only a month and a half) but I'm slowly losing it . . .

Well, Pat talked to another woman at the apartment complex and asked some more questions and they talked for a few minutes. He called me afterwards and said that we're okay and that we don't have anything to worry about. She said that we shouldn't fret over small things like that.

There are only a few things that I can't do until I'm added to the lease:

  • Can't change my mailing address
  • Can't park in front of the apartment
  • Can't call in maintenance issues with the apartment
  • Can't have a key to the mailbox

But I think that Pat might work around that one and just have a copy made for me anyway.

So, that's the short of it and we're both relieved beyond belief.

Friday
Exhaustion. Pure exhaustion. I stayed home and watch my Sci-Fi Friday TV and talked to Pat for over an hour afterwards. He finds out that his "miracle worker" lady his parents have been raving about has nothing good to tell him. The best she can get for him is $74,000 towards a house. There is nothing in this county (other than a trailer ina trailer park) available, and liveable, for less than $100,000. So, we've decided to look at renting something for a year and hopefully the situation will be better a year from now and we can get some more finances and other things to look better as well.

Saturday
Had an okay day until 1pm and then had a breakdown. I spoke to Pat and the wanted to try and do something wit me and the boys but with the cast a lot of things are out for me. So, I told him, "Just do something with the boys and get some quality time together and call me later." He says he'll call the movie theater and see if they can make arrangements for me and my cast and then call me later.

I get a call around 5:15pm and he tells me that the movie theater said no-go because anything extra (to prop my foot up on) would be considered a fire hazzard. I kinda knew it so I wasn't surprised by their answer. So, he asks me, "What do you want to do?" I've been having a semi-bad "I feel like shit and utterly useless" day so having him ask me that just sent me over the edge. I basically said, "If I knew what to do I'd be the first one to tell you. But I"m pretty limited in what I can do because I have to prop my foot up or else my toes and my leg will swell. So, to put it nicely, 'I'm fucked!' is my situation."

We talk some more and I try and tell him, that there's nothing I can really do other than be a bump on a log because of my current cast-status. I can't handle it any more and I'm crying like crazy and say, "I gotta go, bye" and then hang up on him.

I spent the next hour crying and hobbling to the bathroom and then another hour in the recliner feeling sorry for myself.

I finally get an appetite for something to eat around 7:15 so I give him a call and tell him that I'm feeling better and that I'll be over with something to eat soon.

So, I eat my dinner (chicken sandwich and fries) then we head upstairs (with no a/c or fan) and watch Sin City.

We putter around for awhile and the boys behave themselves pretty well and then we head for bed a little after 11pm but it's not even 20 minutes later when I have another bought and end up crying and Pat's asking, "What did I do?" Somewhere between sobs and sniffling I tell him that it's nothing to do with him but that I feel so utterly useless and that it's 8 weeks worth of frustration just coming to the surface and I can't hold it back any more. So, he does the good boyfriend thing and just cuddles me and tells me that he hates to see me so upset and that if he could, he'd fix everything for me.

Takes me about 20 minutes to calm down and then somewhere around there it's lights out because I don't remember anything.

Sunday
7:30am wake-up call from Pat when he crawls back in bed but I don't mind. It gives us some "alone time" in bed before we head upstairs an hour later to get a start on our day.

We have breakfast then between all the chaos that are the boys, we finally head out al ittle after 1pm to check out 2 rental houses and an apartment complex that has a 3-bedroom unit available.

House #1
Crossed off the list. It looks "okay" on the outside and a total pig-sty inside. Someone is obviously living in there (sign on the door says to watch out for cats when you opent he door) and there are dirty clothes and shoes and dirty pots/pans all over the place. They're asking for $900/month and want $137,000 for the house itself. Next!

House #2
Might be a possibility. 900-ish sq. feet. 1 car detached garage. 3 bedrooms, 1 bathroom, finished basement. New vinyl siding and what seems like freshly painted trim. No door or doorwall leading to the backyard...front and side doors. The windows look really old and to be made of aluminum. This has a big question mark on it right now. The rent would be $950/month.

Apartment Complex 1. Three bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 100-1200 sq. ft. The property is very nice and the oldest units are 8 years old. The 3 bedroom unit is the only one that'll be available soon but there is a 2 bedroom until that we're going to check out tomorrow after work (they're almost identical except for the 3rd bedroom) to get a feel for it and get a better look at the entire complex. Rent would be around $1025/month but for all the extra room it would be worth it. Pat's father said he'd help chip in for the security deposit and some rent money for awhile while our expenses are tight. Only thing with this is, if we decided we want to be here and we're approved, we have 7 days to move in.

I'll post more as I find out more...

Sunday morning as everyone (but Pat & myself) got ready to head out the door for their vacation up north, I got a big surprise.

Everyone was outside loading up the truck and then as I'm starting to make my way to the stairs to go up and then outside to see everyone off, in comes Conner and he races down the stairs, hugs me and says goodbye. I hug him back tell him to have fun but to also be good. He says "Okay" and then races back up the stairs.

Before I can move, Tyler is down the stairs and gives me a hug and tells me goodbye too. I hug him back, say, "Have a good time but try and listen to your grandpa, okay?" He smiles, says, "Thanks and I will" and then races back outside.

So . . . I got hugs from both of the boys even though I found out that Marty had to prod them to come down. He told them, "She can't come up here as easily as you can go down there."  But that's okay. The fact that they did it and hugged me without hesitation (especially Tyler since he doesn't hug me as often as Conner does) was very sweet.

So, most of you know that Pat has asked me to go with him and the boys when he moves (I told him that I would but that I won't put my name on the mortgage unless our names match). He said "No problem."

That was about a month ago.

Fastforward to Saturday night. We're sitting at a table with his parents (playing Euchre; Marty and I kicked Pat & Barb's butts!) and his mom says: "Those pots and pans I ordered will be in soon. But if you're not getting them until you're outta here."

I laugh and proceed to trump her card and she yells at me, "You PITA!"

Then she says to Pat, "If you don't then they'll just sit here."

Marty says, "Oh no they're not. You're not keeping more junk in this house!"

Barb says, "Fine, then I'll just have to give them away. Maybe a wedding present."

Marty says, "Who's getting married? Sheila doesn't need any thing because John'll buy it for her."

Barb laughs and says, "Well, maybe Pat."

Pat's dealing cards and says, "One thing at a time here...there's a way of doing things and an order that needs to be followed."

I think he was going to say, "I need a house first," but he didn't say anything else after that.

Barb and Marty laugh and she says, "Well, you better hurry up because they're coming and I want to get rid of these couches too!"

I just smiled, laughed and kept my mouth shut.

The topic of marriage and engagements has come up before so I know that Pat is the kind of guy who likes to plan this type of thing all on his own and that he doesn't like to be pushed. No problem. I don't want to know when it's coming anyway. That's where all the emotion is anyway.

Ya know what I mean?

Anyway . . . I just wanted to post this wee, little revelation that allowed a small peak into his brain where the big M is concerned.

Pat's b-day Weekend:

Saturday

I took him to dinner on Saturday (and ate at the normal dinner hour, kids were with Sheila) and then we went to a local comedy club and saw the 8pm show. It was pretty good and since I was on crutches we got up the service elevator and were allowed to be seated first. Then, we went back to the house, sat on the couch and I have him a back scratch/rub before going to bed then . . . had some "fun" before going to sleep.

Sunday

His family came over and we all had dinner then went to bed a little late than normal then woke up on Monday for some b-day nookie, had breakfast, got ready then went out to look at houses/neighborhoods. Had lunch and dinner together then I left before he went to his game. So, it was a pretty good weekend.

It was really nice to have Saturday night alone. His parents were watching Mason & Makenna and the boys were with Sheila. It was so nice and very needed for us.

 

House Hunting:

Yesterday, we went out looking at neighborhoods and houses. So far we're pretty much in agreement with everything we've seen. But, I did have to remind him, again, that if he's closer to work, then I'm further and as it stands right now, it's already and hour from my work to his parents place. He thought I was trying to be funny but when he looked at me with a silly look on his face I said, "I'm not kidding. One of us is gonna end up driving further to work and dinner will probably be around 7pm."

But the good thing that came out of it was this, "So, what do you think? You haven't really said anything." He actually asked me something without me having to prod him or anything! So that's good.

I told him, "Well, I pretty much agree with most of what you've said with one exception. You can't let things like drapes in the windows throw you."

He said that "if they can't put up decent drapes/blinds then who knows that the house looks like inside?"

I laughed and said, "Well, maybe that's their taste? Hell, my mom left those damn 40's drapes in my room for years before I got blinds."

He said, "Well, that's just frugal."

I said, "No, that just means my mom didn't care because it was 'my room' and not hers." Then I said, "You can't let piddly little things like that throw you. There could be any number of reasons why things are like that and they shouldn't be such a high gague on your list."

He can worry about things like that after we start getting to see the insides of houses instead of just what we can see as we drive by. I was going to say, "Hell, I'll learn how to sew and make some drapes if you're that worried!" But...I kept my mouth shut.

Here's one of the houses I found yesterday after we came back. Pat might check it out today or we'll try again this weekend when everyone is gone again.

There was one house that didn't look too bad but when we got a little past it, I saw the garage in the back and the garage door was completely trashed! It must've happened between the time of the listing and when we saw it yesterday because it was pretty bad. I also think that the house has been empty for awhile because how could you live there with a door like that? It's one of those 2-car garage doors so it's not something small. It's like someone just pushed it up and then squeezed it in the middle to look like a bow tie. This is the house.

This one we happened to come across as we were driving around the neighborhood and I wrote down the address. It's a rental but it doesn't say in the listing if it's available for purchase. But it was very cute when we drove by.

This was a last minute add and I would've missed it if Pat hadn't said anything. I can't really remember much of it when we drove by though. I told Pat that it reminds me of a barn.

But, the one I liked the most after I started looking online again, was this one. It's small, but the inside looks immaculate.  I really want Pat and I to go out this weekend and take a look at it. The back yard looks nice and the fence looks to be in good condition.

Pat's hoping to hear from the bank lady, again, so we can start making appointments to see some of these houses.

Friday

I brought over the maps I made for Pat so he can see where family (his and mine), his place of work and mine all are geographically. We talked shortly about the new area I scoped out (Ferndale/Royal Oak) and there are a lot of available houses (more than in our neck of the woods) for under $100,000. But, he's pretty set on stayin in the same area so he can get help from his dad and brothers. I told him that I was looking at a location that wouldn't be too hard on either of us for going to/from work but he didn't like it. Oh well, I tried.

 

Saturday

I left the house early for my Dr. appointment then went home and crashed for a bit (very tired) then took a shower and crashed again. It was almost 4pm by the time I got up (again) and dried my hair (it was 1/2 dry) and packed a back for the rest of the weekend with Pat.

We ended up getting a movie but didn't watch it and Sheila came over and the four of us (including Barb) stayed up until almost midnight playing Euchre. We didn't get anywhere near the movie.

 

Sunday

A very slow day. Pat and I didn't get out of bed until almost 10am . . . a new record for either of us. By the time we had breakfast, showered and were ready to go anywhere, it was almost 1pm. Sheila volunteered to take the boys to the driving range (golf) but she had the Vette and could only take one. So, all five of us end up at the driving range.

Pat has brought up the idea of letting Tyler (he'll be 13 next May) try his hand at being a Caddy at one of the local golf courses next summer. Tyler has no "work ethic" (he can't take out the trash on a weekly basis) what so ever and needs, in a bad way, to learn that most people work hard for their money and that money just doesn't keep coming out of your pockets when you want it.

Tyler has recently said that he wants to try golf now (Pat is having more money nightmares) but has absolutely no desire to take any golf lessons. He thinks he can just go out there and do his thing and be okay. He's also not one to take constructive criticism very well. Pat tried to give him pointers on how to stand and swing the club yesterday (at the driving range) and Tyler just blew up at him and said, "Gee thanks for letting me know how stupid I am dad!" and threw down his club and sat down on the divider. Pat just rolled his eyes, said, "I'm only trying to help you improve but if you want to do it your way, be my gues," and walked back over to sit down next to me.

So, I'll have to revisit this next summer and see if it goes anywhere.

We stop at the store on the way back to the house so Pat can pick up his lunch meat (he'll only eat Kowalski Bologna and no other kind of bologna).

Conner immediately kicks off his shoes and leaves them where I can trip over therem. So, I tell him, "Get down here and put these shoes where they're supposed to go."  He huffs and says, "Oh my god! They're not in the way."  I've had it by then and say, "Don't you 'Oh my God' me. Get down here and put them away." He huffs some more but comes down and puts them away. I almost smacked my own hand over my mouth when I said, "Don't you 'Oh my God' me."

After that, Pat heads out to cut the lawn while I bum it on the couch and put my foot back up (it was feeling a little swollen again). I had a half sandwich (using his bologna, hehe) while he was outside and read a bit of my book at the counter as well. He takes a break to come in for lunch (always ice cold milk and a peanut butter and jelly sandwich on the weekends) then goes back outside to fnish up.

About 3:30 Pat asks if I want to go to the movies and I say, "Of course," so we then planned on the 4:45 showing of The Fantastic Four and head out. Before we left the house Pat told them, "If you're hungry now, eat a little something here because you're not going to get anything other than something to drink while we're there. Do you understand me?"  Of course they both had a mini-fit but we left anyway.

The boys were talking about goig to see Rebound and I just cringed in my seat. Pat dropped me off at the door so I wouldn't have to walk across the parking lot and I headed in. I waited a minute and when I still saw them circling around, I walked up to the counter and bought 4 tickets for The Fantastic Four. Yeah, it might've been kinda crappy of me to do, but I wasn't about to sit through Rebound if I had anything to say about it. They walked up to me just as I was getting my change back (I ended up paying for the tickets, but no biggie). Then, they headed straight for the concession stand and I said, "I'm going to go in and sit down," while they looked for a short line to get their icee's (frozen coke). 10 minutes later, they come in with icee's and Pat has a medium bag of pop corn which he gave Conner about 1/4 of in a separate bag. Meanwhile, Tyler is still moaning about not being able to get some candy. And he's still moaning about it when we leave the theater and we're discussing what to have for dinner. "If you had let me get some candy I wouldn't be so hungry now!" he's practically yelling. I told him, "You had a chicken thigh before we left so you shouldn't be nearly as hungry as you're claiming to be." He got snotty and said, "Just because no one else is doesn't meant that I'm not!"

We're still discussing what to have for dinner and Pat asks them what they want. Sloppy Joe's is Tyler's response and Conner says, "Whatever."  Pat and Tyler go into Kroger while Conner and I stay in the car. It takes them about 10 minutes to buy 3 items and Pat forgets to buy french fries. After we're on the road, I can hear Tyler's lips smacking and say, "What are you eating?" I look at Pat and he says, "It's just Mike & Ikes."  I just give him a look and he get's defensive, "What?!?"  I just look at him and say, "Never mind. I'm not going to say anything," and then turn my head to look out the window.

Back at the house I end up cooking some potato wedges along with the sloppy joe's  and the boys are getting ready to head outside. Meanwhile, Tyler is still munching on the box of candy and I said, "Stop eating those! We'll be having dinner in about 20-25 minutes!" Tyler laughs and says, "Just one more!" and then Pat yells at him from the grill. I just stand at the stove and shake my head. Why can't Pat see that he's just letting them do whatever they want?  **sigh**

10 minutes later, Pat and I are talking in the kitchen when there's some kind of commotion at the front door and then Conner is diving down the stairs with all his goalie pads and skates still on, his feet/skates going all over the wall as he dives down the stairs. I shout, "Hey, what's going on?!?" and Pat yells at Conner about having all his stuff on while in the house. Meanwhile, Conner is hiding behind Pat and here comes Tyler after him. Apparently, Tyler was shooting the buck at Conner extra high and Conner got fed up with it and stopped what he was doing. That's when Tyler started after him and Conner fled into the house. Conner stripped all his stuff off and left it in the kitchen and then pouted. Tyler starts after him again when Conner tries to sneak past him, and puts him in a head lock and then tries to push him into the ground. Pat tears them apart and makes Tyler go outside. All the while, Tyler is laughing at Conner. Conner takes his gear and puts it away in the garage and then heads upstairs.

There's about 10 more minutes of peace when Conner comes back downstairs, holding his right shoulder and crying. Apparently, Tyler came back in the house, went upstairs, and pushed Conner into something and took the memory card out of the GameCube. Pat knows that Conner's memory card was in there earlier this morning and now it's missing and Tyler claims that he doesn't know where it is.

This kind of shit happens all the time and yet, Pat doesn't really do much about it. I understand his frustration. Barb undermines him constantly because she won't agree to follow along with the rules/restrictions that Pat sets on the boys. He can't ground them because Barb'll push them outside after 15 minutes because they're bugging her. 

Pat cannot get out and into a house or condo soon enough . . . and since I'll be living there, Pat and I will most definately have to be on the same page when it comes to the boys. When I use my, "I'm not kidding," voice with the boys, they may huff about it, they they end up doing what I tell them to do. And, when I ask for help (especially when I can't walk quite right) I always use "please help me" and say "thank you" when we're done. It's cool and they always say, "Sure," when I ask. So, we'll see how things are once everything is squared away and we're all in one place with no one else around. I get the feeling that the phrase, "She's strict" will be soon replaced with something a bit more mean.

Oh well, them's the breaks. I only put up with so much from the boys and they pretty much know when I've had enough and not to tick me off.

Okay, I'm rambling now and not making much sense of anything now so I'll end this here.

Saturday: Big hockey day. Conner has his first game of the new season and Tyler has his championship game.

I woke up around 7:00 and feeling a little lusty, so I do my best to tease Pat while he's sleeping before I make my move. It's been awhile since I've been this randy in the morning, so I thought I'd make the most of it and try to make a little "morning love" before we headed upstairs.

I can hear the sounds of feet going up and down the stairs and moving about, but it's fairly quiet (this goes on for about 30 minutes) so I keep going about my business.. I finally get him to the point where he's caught up with me and then I hear a loud boom (someone skipped the last few steps and "landed" on the floor) followed by another one and then one of the boys started yelling.

I know it's a lost cause at this point. I sigh heavily and roll away and face the wall. I have to admit, I'm not exactly the happiest person right then but I figured I should collect myself before I started crying (being this close to starting my period has my emotions being very, very touchy). I guess Pat heard me sniffle, because he rolled over and pressed himself into my back and wrapped an arm around me. I got about a good 30 seconds out of that before more hell started breaking loose upstairs. Pat got out of bed, put a robe on and went up to investigate.

I got dressed (t-shirt and shorts) and headed upstairs after I had composed myself. I took my cold medication and sat down at the table to read my book (Reunion in Death). Marty comes in and tells me what fun stuff he found in the upper level bathroom: pee, all over the floor and it had been there all night. When he inquired to all three boys, who had done it (he wasn't going to punish any of them, he just wanted to know) Tyler burst into tears because he assumed that he was being blamed for it. One thing about Tyler; when he gets blamed for something he hasn't done, he cries. When he has done it, he gets quiet and doesn't talk.

Conner was just being a little hellion. The doctor started him on Straterra on Friday (he started Friday night), but it's going to take quite a few weeks before a difference is noticed. So, Conner had his breakfast alone (Tyler and Hunter would eat later) at the counter and then was let back upstairs to get dressed.

I won't go into more detail, but suffice it to say that it was a very long morning before we left for hockey, and that was only 90 minutes. I had, had my fill of Tyler and Conner's attitudes and ignoring Pat to last me the rest of the entire day.

Conner's team won their first game, and Conner made his first goal. Tyler's team wasn't as fortunate. They lost but their team still had a little celebration (cake and juice boxes).

We got back to the house a little before 1:00 but I had to go and run some errands, so I didn't stick around. I think Pat knew I was close to my "limit" with the boys, so he kissed me goodbye and told me he'd call me later. So, I took off and ran my errands before going home to get some more things done there and then start to get ready for later that night.

For some reason, my "irked feeling" towards the boys hadn't gone away by the time I got back to Pat's around 5:00. It wasn't too bad, but I think that's because the boys were "doing their own thing" and not pestering anyone.

So, I hang out for awhile and then about 6:00 it didn't look like we were going to be eating until 7:00 or so, so I headed upstairs to do my hair (takes me about 45 minutes). And, of course, about half-way through, I can hear them downstairs and they're eating. No biggie, but I always feel a little akward when I sit at the counter by myself and eat. So, I finish with my hair about 7:15 and make myself a sandwich.

One irkesome thing here: No comments from Pat about my curly hair. Now, every time I go over there (usually on a Sunday) with super-straight hair, he comments on it; every single time. So, I figured, since I was upstairs doing my hair (and he came in twice to "check on me") he'd say something about it. But does he? Nope. *sigh* Pat goes back downstairs after checking on me, to see if I'd eaten anything, and changes clothes and does whatever else he needs to do to get ready.

My sandwich now finished, I head to the bathroom to do my make-up and check on the hair. It doesn't take me long to finish up, so I plop myself into the rocker and sit by the fire and wait for Pat. He's my gague of when I go and change my clothes. So, if he's completely done, I'll go and change my clothes and then we leave. About 10 minutes later, he's back up and changed into new clothes and carrying his black shoes; he's all ready to go. So, I make my way to his room and change my own clothes.

At this point, I'm mentally crossing my fingers that we'll be able to get out of the house by 8:15. That's if the boys don't give Pat any trouble.

Yeah, that didn't happen. We didn't leave until about 8:35 or so and my "irked" feeling was back and even Pat was starting to get on my nerves (but it wasn't his fault).

He cracks a joke about my headlights and then asks, as we're almost out of the subdivision, "I can drive if you don't want to."

I look at him out of the corner of my eye and said, "I don't care. If you want to drive, you can drive."

I can feel him looking at me (I resist the urge to look at him in return) and then I can feel his hand on my right leg and he gives it a little squeeze. "Are you okay?" he asks.

I tell him that I'll be okay eventually; that I'm just very irritated. When he asks why, I tell him that it's because of the boys and their attitude that seems to be carrying on from earlier in the day. I turn my head and look at him as I say this. I reassure him that it's not him I'm irritated with (I already got over the driving thing) and that I'd be fine and not irritated in a little while. I think he was a little skeptical, but he said, "okay."

We talked about little things on the way, but nothing big. We make it to the bar a little after 9:15 and when we walk in, we think that we're good because there are a lot of empty tables. That was mistake number 1.

We find out, that all six of those tables (nice, long ones) were reserved for some chick's bachelorette party. Not to mention the smaller room near the front door; most of that was reserved for that damn party too. So, there was no place to sit and this bar, it's not exactly designed for standing either.

We talk to Kelley (singer in the band we were there to see) for a little while and then made our way to the less crowded part of the bar; near the front door. After 20 minutes or so, Virginia walks in and we clue her in on the situation. While Pat's talking to her, I turn to the guy who's working the door and ask him if he could give us our money back since there was no place to sit. That was mistake number 2.

He looked at me like I was a moron and said, "No!" Not just "no," but "No!"

Yeah, that didn't make me real happy. My temper flaired and I could just feel myself simmering. So, we stand around for a little while longer; trying to decided what we want to do instead. We do this for about 20 more minutes while we talk with Virginia about various things (turns out that Jennifer is going to come back to MI for a week). All the while, my simmering continues and keeps on rising. I feel angry tears try and break through a couple of times. Once, it did, and I took advantage of the hair and bowed my head a little bit and wiped the tears away.

To shorten this up a bit, we ended up leaving the bar a little after 10:00, after a waitress had come up and offered us a small table (real small) in the very back corner of the bar. She was very nice, but by that point, I was so mad, nothing would've made me want to stay there. So, I told her "Thanks, but give it to someone else." Pat asked me what I wanted to do, but I just said, "I'm leaving" and turned away and walked out the door. I slammed open the outside door and Pat was right behind me.

I got a, "Take it easy missy, you'll hurt yourself," from him since I didn't move out of the door's way fast enough and it hit me in the arm as I was trying to get by it. For once, he had to walk fast to keep up with me. He asked me if I was going to be okay. I just shrugged and said, "I'm so pissed off right now, so no, I'm not okay. I'll get over it though."

So, we walked back to the car and got in. I let it run for a little bit since it was cold out and tried to compose myself. Pat said he'd call up Sandie and see what she and Tim were doing, but she wasn't answering her phone.

I was just sitting there, so Pat said, "Why don't we start driving and head towards home and he'll try her again on the way." So, we left the parking lot and started heading home.

He couldn't get ahold of Sandie and Ivane was home (Matt was studying so she was staying in). So, we decided to shoot some pool over at the Shark Club. It wasn't everyday we got out and neither of us wanted to go back to the house this early.

We got a table right away (which wasn't usual lately for 11pm on a Saturday night) and continued to shoot until 1am. After that, we called it a night and headed home.

I got some good cuddle action with Pat, I think he could tell that I needed it, and soon we were both asleep. I didn't wake up again until 5:30am when I got dressed and headed home.
